intro: Cephalaralia cephalobotrys, commonly known as the crownflower, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy, yellow-orange flower heads that resemble a crown, giving it its common name. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are upright and branching. Cephalaralia cephalobotrys is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of its native environment.
